data.title: Atom doesn't start on Ubuntu 14.04 without sudo
data.body:
I installed Atom from the webupd8 PPA and at that time the application worked (version 0.95 or something like that). I just updated the package (version 0.132.0) and Atom now only starts as root.

If i start it with my normal user i get following error:

```
$ atom -f
[6744:0930/202203:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(161)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
[6744:0930/202204:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(207)] GLib-GObject: cannot register existing type 'DbusmenuMenuitem'
[6744:0930/202204:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(207)] GLib: g_once_init_leave: assertion 'result != 0' failed
[6744:0930/202204:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(207)] GLib-GObject: g_param_spec_object: assertion 'g_type_is_a (object_type, G_TYPE_OBJECT)' failed
[6744:0930/202204:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(207)] GLib-GObject: g_object_class_install_property: assertion 'G_IS_PARAM_SPEC (pspec)' failed
```

Reinstalling the Atom package didn't help. Does anyone have an idea?

data.title: Remember last open tabs

data.title: Atom is busted and broken :(
data.body:
Atom - Version 0.132.0 (0.132.0)
MacBookAir - Mavericks 10.9.5

Everything was fine one day. Then the next day I updated to latest Mavericks and Atom was unusable.

Recent projects are grayed out, unless I have a blank window open, once I open a new blank window, recent project are selectable but often won’t open until after several attempts. (fyi, this was happening before the Mavricks update.)

Now that a recent project is open, no tabs open, even when I click a file in the project, no tabs appear. Each file just opens over the last file.

Here is a Quickcast - http://quick.as/Go1Rhpwl

data.title: atom picks up .gitignore inside a directory and applies it everywhere
data.body:
I've the following setup:

```
> tree
.
└── ipfs
    ├── .gitignore
    ├── ipfs
    ...
> cat ipfs/.gitignore
ipfs

> echo because ipfs/ipfs is a binary.
and atom is ignoring the entire ipfs/ directory

> echo this shouldnt happen because the .gitignore
is within the directory, and shouldn't apply outside!
```

thanks all :heart:

(Stopgap: do `./ipfs` in .gitignore. but this shouldn't be necessary).

Atom render the code like this (I tried to select the line in the image):

Atom version: latest (Compiled today)

Cheers, F0x

data.title: Folder colors don't update to reflect git changes
data.body:
If I save a file, the file (in the sidebar) will change colors to tell me that it has changed, but only if the folder tree is open to that file. If I save it otherwise, the folder will change colors. If the folder tree is collapsed and I save it with a new change to the git repo, the folder will change colors to reflect new changes in the sub folders.

But, this process does not work in reverse. If I am removing git changes (whether through saving from an open file, or git checkout from the command line) the file itself will change colors, if the folder tree is open all the way down. But, the folders above it will not change colors. Likewise, if the folder tree is collapsed at any point, the folders will not change colors to reflect the changed status below them. The folder tree below the folder I am on will change colors (when I open it, of course it updates) but the folder I am on itself will not.

This is a bit hard to explain, so I will illustrate it with an image. 

![atom folders](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3253673/4446071/57bf8414-47ff-11e4-9850-465d0120b71a.png)

The sub-tree has no files changed in it, they were changed, but I removed the changes. The folder was collapsed to the folder that is currently selected. While the folders below expressed the change once it was expanded, the folder that I was on did not express the change, neither did the folders above it. The behavior is a bit confusing. The expected behavior is that the folders above the current one would change to the new updated git status.

data.title: Return disposables from MenuManager::add and add specs
data.body: This is part of the initiative to return disposables in any place we add something we may later want to remove. I'll be opening PRs for each specific subsystem to keep things small.

data.title: Atom crashes at load
data.body:
Ever since Atom got upgraded to Chrome 37 since the 0.126.0 release, I've not been able to load Atom without it crashing (I have tried this on 126, 127, 128, 129, 130, 131 and now 132 builds). I've reverted to using build 0.125.0 for a while, without any issues.

As for debugging, I'm not sure what I can report on since it only gives this dialog window. I'd be interested in knowing how I could contribute by showing what you would need to figure this one out to be fixed.

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5721977/4439511/141d7c84-47b9-11e4-9378-2722473afe91.png)

To clarify things further, I am currently running Chrome Version 37.0.2062.124 m (64-bit) without any issues as the default browser in Windows 8.1 (64-bit).

data.title: getCurrentWordBufferRange doesn't seem to work correctly for words like change-case
data.body:
I'm trying to get the current word under the cursor and the default options of `getCurrentWordBufferRange` should AFAIK enable matching words with non-space separators, but currently the regex seems to have been misconfigured so that it doesn't match word correctly.

Current code:

``` coffee
wordRegExp: ({includeNonWordCharacters}={}) ->
includeNonWordCharacters ?= true
nonWordCharacters = atom.config.get('editor.nonWordCharacters')
segments = ["^[\t ]*$"]
segments.push("[^\\s#{_.escapeRegExp(nonWordCharacters)}]+")
if includeNonWordCharacters
  segments.push("[#{_.escapeRegExp(nonWordCharacters)}]+")
new RegExp(segments.join("|"), "g")
```

Correct code:

``` coffee
wordRegExp: ({includeNonWordCharacters}={}) ->
includeNonWordCharacters ?= true
nonWordCharacters = atom.config.get('editor.nonWordCharacters')
segments = ["^[\t ]*$"]
if includeNonWordCharacters
  segments.push("[#{_.escapeRegExp(nonWordCharacters)}]+")
  segments.push("[^\\s]+")
else
  segments.push("[^\\s#{_.escapeRegExp(nonWordCharacters)}]+")
new RegExp(segments.join("|"), "g")
```

data.title: Ignore `.gitkeep` files in file tree
data.body: Personally, I think it would be a good idea to not let `gitkeep` files show up in the file tree.

data.title: Pressing escape to clear multiple cursors causes the editor to freeze
data.body:
### System Information

Xubuntu 14.04
Atom 0.132.0
### Reproduction Steps
1. Paste the following text into an empty file:
   
   ```
   asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd
   asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd
   asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd
   asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd
   asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd
   asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd asd
   ```
2. Place the cursor on the first word
3. Press and hold _Ctrl + D_ until all words are selected with their own cursor.
4. Press escape to clear the multiple cursors
### Expected Behavior

All cursors are cleared except one
### Actual Behavior

The editor freezes and I have to kill it
### Notes
- The editor only freezes when a fair amount of cursors exist. A handful of selections doesn't seem to cause an issue. I thought about giving an exact number, but it may vary depending on hardware.
- Another way to clear multiple cursors is to click anywhere on the text area. This works fine.
- The top menu bar still seems to work, making me think the freeze is localized to the text area.

data.title: Black title bar - Dark theme
data.body: It would be great to have a black title bar with the Dark theme activated.

data.title: File duplicated in different project
data.body:
Hello, This is a step by step of what I remember happening leading up to the duplication of the file.

Opened a Wordpress theme package in Atom, when I was finished I closed that window (I did not close atom).
Selected 'Open...' from the menu and opened a different project.
Opened a few pages and made some edits.
Opened settings and saw that a theme was out of date so I updated it.
Pasted some info from a website into a file and saved it.

It was when hitting 'control s' that I noticed a new file appear (page.php):

![atom-files](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/775993/4430240/52a763d8-4625-11e4-9b1a-d94cf6d6feea.png)

This file was from the previous Wordpress project and it was now in the new project.
I can't recall if I had been editing that file or if it was open when I closed the previous project.

I have since upgraded to version 0.132.0 (The request to upgrade was in the menu) So I guess the version was the one before this.
The theme I updated was Monokai (https://atom.io/packages/monokai).

data.title: No way to remove folder from project
data.body: How does one remove the folder from the sidebar?

data.title: Configurable close-tab behavior (select tab to the right)
data.body: I know the select-tab-to-the-left on-close-tab is the sublime text behaviour. But, firefox, chrome, gedit, geany, vim, anjuta, eclipse, etc. select the tab to the right (sublime's the odd one). Can this behaviour be an option?

data.title: Feature request: Implement cut whole line, when no selection
data.body:
It is the norm that cutting a line when no selection cuts the entire line, but in Atom it behaves like backspace

I am aware of https://github.com/tekkub/cut-line/ but this is such an fundamental behaviour, that it really should be in core.

I'm happy to implement it if the maintainers just give it an ok :)
